string.text: Thompson M1A1

The Thompson is a blowback-operated, air-cooled, magazine-fed selective-fire submachine gun. The M1A1 variant has a significantly reduced fire-rate and a simplified design produced on request of the US Army for cheaper mass production during WWII. As a result, the Blish lock, oiling system and compensator were removed and the alternative receiver no longer accepts drum mags.

Thompson Model 1921

Originally developed to replace the bolt-action service rifles in use by the United States army, the Thompson is a blowback-operated, air-cooled, magazine-fed selective-fire submachine gun. This variant of the Thompson, also nicknamed the "Chicago Typewriter" features a faster fire-rate and the Blish Lock system for weapon operation that is missing from the later M1A1 model.
